channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Match Group’s rape problem: A lawsuit alleges that inaction by Tinder and Hinge’s owner allowed abusers to stay on the apps
item.description: A shareholder alleges the company "has known… which users have been reported for drugging, assaulting, or raping their dates since at least 2016" but ...

item.title: Adidas stole sandal design from traditional Mexican artisans, Sheinbaum says
item.description: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum said Adidas was already in talks with authorities in Oaxaca to provide “compensation for the people who were plagi...

item.title: An Unusual Soccer Finale in Italy Reveals Libya’s Frailties
item.description: With two governments, and two soccer leagues, Libya is holding its soccer championship in Italy for a second year. Volatile politics and fans follow.

item.title: Trump crypto firm plans launch of public company that will hold family token
item.description: World Liberty Financial’s latest project would mimic other public firms that have amassed Bitcoin in hopes of boosting their share price.

item.title: The Tycoons Who Profit From India’s Thirst for Russian Oil
item.description: President Trump’s new front in the trade war against India focuses on a pair of enormous refineries with extraordinary owners.

item.title: William H. Webster, Who Ran Both the F.B.I. and the C.I.A., Dies at 101
item.description: A former federal judge, he first came to the F.B.I. just as two of the worst spies in American history were running rampant.

item.title: Trump to replace Biden Fed appointee with Stephen Miran, chair of the White House’s Council of Economic Advisers
item.description: Adriana Kugler stepped down Friday. Miran, if approved by the Senate, will serve until January 31, 2026.
